# gridify

[![R-CMD-check](https://github.com/pharmaverse/gridify/actions/workflows/R-CMD-check.yaml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/pharmaverse/gridify/actions/workflows/R-CMD-check.yaml)
[![Codecov test
coverage](https://codecov.io/gh/pharmaverse/gridify/graph/badge.svg)](https://app.codecov.io/gh/pharmaverse/gridify)
[![pharmaverse gridify
Badge](http://pharmaverse.org/shields/gridify.svg)](https://pharmaverse.org)
[![CRAN
status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/gridify)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=gridify)

## Overview

In the pharmaceutical industry, and many other fields that rely heavily
on data reporting, there is often a need to create figures and tables
with specific graphical arrangements. These could be titles, subtitles,
captions, footnotes, and other text elements that provide important
context to the data being shown.

However, creating the headers and footers etc. and correctly positioning
them around the output can be challenging, often requiring fine-tuning.
This can be time-consuming and can lead to inconsistencies in the way
the figures and tables are presented across different projects.

`gridify` builds on the base R `grid` package and makes it easy to add
flexible and customizable information around a figure or table using a
pre-defined or custom layout. The `gridify` package works with all of
the following input types, creating consistency when using various
different inputs:

**grob**, **gtable**, **ggplot**, **flextable**, **gt**, **base R plots
(by formula)**

Whilst **rtables** are not directly supported, we can use **rtables**
with `gridify` by first converting them to **flextable** (with
**rtables.officer**).

As `gridify` is based on the graphical tool **grid**, any figure or
table inputs are converted to a `grob` object in `gridify` and the
result of using `gridify` is always a graphical image.

## Installation

You can install the newest release version from CRAN:

``` r
install.packages("gridify")
```

Or you can install the newest development version from Pharmaverse
GitHub (example):

``` r
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("pharmaverse/gridify", build_manual = TRUE)
```

## Example

The workflow of the package is as follows:

1.  Create your object (`ggplot`, `gt` etc.)
2.  Choose a layout (predefined or custom). Use
    [`get_layouts()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/get_layouts.md)
    to see the predefined options
3.  Use
    [`gridify()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/gridify.md)
    to create a `gridify` object
4.  Print the `gridify` object to see empty cells
5.  Use
    [`set_cell()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/set_cell.md)
    to fill in the various text elements in the layout (headers, footers
    etc.)

The following example uses a table created by the `gt` package and the
`gridify` layout
[`pharma_layout_base()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/pharma_layout_base.md).

``` r
library(gridify)
# install.packages("gt")
# gt needs gtable
# install.packages("gtable")
library(gt)
# (to use |> version 4.1.0 of R is required, for lower versions we recommend %>% from magrittr)

tab <- gt::gt(head(mtcars, n = 10))  |>
  gt::tab_options(
    table.width = gt::pct(100),
    data_row.padding = gt::px(10),
    table_body.hlines.color = "white",
    table.font.size = 12
  )

# Use `gridify()` to create a `gridify` object
gridify_object <- gridify(
  object = tab,
  # Choose a layout (predefined or custom)
  layout = pharma_layout_base(
    margin = grid::unit(c(0.5, 0.5, 0.5, 0.5), "inches"),
    global_gpar = grid::gpar(fontfamily = "serif", fontsize = 10)
  )
)
# Print the `gridify` object to see empty cells
gridify_object
# Use `set_cell()` to fill in the various text elements in the layout (headers etc.)
gridify_object_fill <- gridify_object |>
  set_cell("header_left_1", "My Company") |>
  set_cell("header_left_2", "<PROJECT> / <INDICATION>") |>
  set_cell("header_left_3", "<STUDY>") |>
  set_cell("header_right_1", "CONFIDENTIAL") |>
  set_cell("header_right_2", "<Draft or Final>") |>
  set_cell("header_right_3", "Data Cut-off: YYYY-MM-DD") |>
  set_cell("output_num", "<Table> xx.xx.xx") |>
  set_cell("title_1", "<Title 1>") |>
  set_cell("title_2", "<Title 2>") |>
  set_cell("title_3", "<Optional Title 3>") |>
  set_cell("by_line", "By: <GROUP>, <optionally: Demographic parameters>") |>
  set_cell("note", "<Note or Footnotes>") |>
  set_cell("references", "<References:>") |>
  set_cell("footer_left", "Program: <PROGRAM NAME>, YYYY-MM-DD at HH:MM") |>
  set_cell("footer_right", "Page xx of nn") |>
  set_cell("watermark", "DRAFT")

gridify_object_fill

print(gridify_object_fill)
```

![Example of gridify output](reference/figures/README-example-1.png)

Note: Get the image using  
`export_to(gridify_object_fill, to = "mypng.png", res = 300, width = 2300, height = 1900)`

## Documentation Guide

For more information please visit the following vignettes:

- **Getting Started**
  [`vignette("gridify", package = "gridify")`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/articles/gridify.md) -
  A case study in how the above example is constructed.
- **Simple Examples**
  [`vignette("simple_examples", package = "gridify")`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/articles/simple_examples.md) -
  A showcase of implementations of `gridify` for the various possible
  inputs.
- **Multi-Page Examples**
  [`vignette("multi_page_examples", package = "gridify")`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/articles/multi_page_examples.md) -
  Showing how to use `gridify` in more complex situations e.g a for-loop
  for multiple results.
- **Create Custom Layout**
  [`vignette("create_custom_layout", package = "gridify")`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/articles/create_custom_layout.md) -
  An explanation on how to create a custom layout to use in `gridify`.
- **Transparency of gridify**
  [`vignette("transparency", package = "gridify")`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/articles/transparency.md) -
  How to extract the raw grid code to reproduce a `gridify` object.

## Related packages

Other packages exist which add headers, footers, and other elements to
figures and tables; most of the input classes to `gridify` already
support these features. However, `gridify` was created not to supersede
these, but to be used in conjunction with, in a way that is flexible for
all use cases and consistent across various inputs.

## Contributing

Interested in contributing? Check out the contributing guidelines,
`CONTRIBUTING.md`. Please note that this project is released with a Code
of Conduct, `CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md`. By contributing to this project, you
agree to abide by its terms.

for their support:

Dallimore, Laetitia Lemoine, Daniel Vicencio Perez, Richard Abdy

# Package index

## gridify Users

### main gridify interface

- [`gridify()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/gridify.md)
  : Create a gridify object
- [`set_cell()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/set_cell.md)
  : Add text elements to a gridify cell
- [`print(`*`<gridifyClass>`*`)`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/print-gridifyClass-method.md)
  : Print method for gridifyClass
- [`show(`*`<gridifyClass>`*`)`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/show-gridifyClass-method.md)
  : Show method for gridifyClass
- [`show(`*`<gridifyLayout>`*`)`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/show-gridifyLayout-method.md)
  : Show method for gridifyLayout
- [`show_spec()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/show_spec.md)
  : Show the layout specifications of a gridifyClass or gridifyLayout
- [`show_layout()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/show_layout.md)
  : Show the layout in a given gridify object or layout
- [`show_cells()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/show_cells.md)
  : Show the cells in a gridify object or layout
- [`export_to()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/export_to.md)
  : Export gridify objects to a file

### existing layouts

- [`get_layouts()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/get_layouts.md)
  : Get the gridify layouts
- [`simple_layout()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/simple_layout.md)
  : Simple Layout for a gridify object
- [`complex_layout()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/complex_layout.md)
  : Complex Layout for a gridify object
- [`pharma_layout`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/pharma_layout.md)
  : Pharma Layouts
- [`pharma_layout_base()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/pharma_layout_base.md)
  : Base Function for Pharma Layouts
- [`pharma_layout_A4()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/pharma_layout_A4.md)
  : Pharma Layout (A4) for a gridify object
- [`pharma_layout_letter()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/pharma_layout_letter.md)
  : Pharma Layout (Letter) for a gridify object
- [`layout_issue`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/layout_issue.md)
  : Template for Layout Issues Note

### gridify utils

- [`paginate_table()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/paginate_table.md)
  : Split a data frame into pages for multi-page tables

## gridify custom layout development

### functions

- [`gridifyLayout()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/gridifyLayout.md)
  : Create a gridifyLayout
- [`gridifyObject()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/gridifyObject.md)
  : Create a gridifyObject
- [`gridifyCells()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/gridifyCells.md)
  : Create a gridifyCells
- [`gridifyCell()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/gridifyCell.md)
  : Create a gridifyCell

### S4 classes

- [`gridifyClass-class`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/gridifyClass-class.md)
  : gridifyClass class
- [`gridifyLayout-class`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/gridifyLayout-class.md)
  : gridifyLayout class
- [`gridifyObject-class`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/gridifyObject-class.md)
  : gridifyObject class
- [`gridifyCells-class`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/gridifyCells-class.md)
  : gridifyCells class
- [`gridifyCell-class`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/gridify/reference/gridifyCell-class.md)
  : gridifyCell class
